Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by:  Rev. David B. Cousins, Bridge Street AWME Church, 277 Stuyvesant Avenue, Brooklyn, NY  11221

Motion to spread the invocation infull upon the record by COUNCIL MEMBER BOYLAND
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:  Rev. David B. Cousins, Bridge Street AWME Church, 277 Stuyvesant Avenue, Brooklyn, NY  11221

COUNCIL MEMBER BOYLAND Moved to spread the invocation in full upon the Minutes and adopted.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of WEDNESDAY, SEPTEMBER 29, 1999 to be adopted and printed by Council Member Abel
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Abel Moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of Wednesday, September 29, 1999 be adopted and printed.

Items.Title: Messages and Papers from the Mayor

Land Use Call-Ups

Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d(b)(3) of the New York City Council, the  Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application  Number 2000012 ZSR, special permit, shall be subject to Council review. This application is related to application number 2000017 ZMR which is subject to Council review pursuant to Section 197-d of the New York City Charter, Borough of Manhattan, Council District no. 49.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Stadium Capacity, Staten Island  (C2000012ZSR) Manhattan

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling upon Allianz, BASF, Bayer, BMW, Commerzbank, DaimlerChrysler, Degussa-Huels, Deutsche Bank, Henkel, Hoechst, Mannesmann, Siemens, ThyssenKrupp, Veba, Viag, Volkswagen and the many other companies who utilized slave and forced labor in its factories during World War II to compensate such survivors with an amount commensurate to the pain and suffering endured by them.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: World War II labor in factories

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the President of the United States to grant clemency to Jonathan Jay Pollard, currently serving an inequitable and incomparably harsh sentence in federal prison.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: Resolution commemorating the 61st anniversary of Kristallnacht, "The Night of Broken Glass," in memory of all those who fell victim to the reign of anti-Semitism and senseless violence that took place on that night and all who suffered and perished in its wake.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.

Items.Title: A Local Law in relation to a street name, Reverend Dr. Hylton L. James Boulevard, Borough of Brooklyn.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Reverend Dr. Hylton L. James Blvd, Brooklyn

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the appropriate committee of the Council to hold a hearing on the issue of service guarantees in City contracts to assure that electric current will be provided to streetlights and calling upon City agencies to vigorously enforce any existing provisions in its contracts to ensure uninterrupted electric service to streetlights and to modify those contracts to better ensure such electric service.

Resolution calling on insurance companies to reevaluate and lower their auto insurance rates for New York City residents to reflect the significant decline in auto theft in the last five years throughout New York City and calling upon the State Insurance Department to use its rate approval power to ensure that the auto insurance rates in New York City reflect this decline.
A Local Law in relation to a street name, Way of the Finest, Borough of the Bronx.
Items.AgendaNote: Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Name Change, Way of the Finest, Bronx

Items.Title: A resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to amend the Criminal Procedure Law to allow the expungement of criminal records in certain situations.
Items.MatterName: Amend Criminal  Law, Expunge Certain Criminal Records

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon all members of the New York State Congressional delegation to reject H.R. 1032, which would prohibit certain causes of action against gun manufacturers.
Resolution denouncing the inhumane desecration of the Weissensee Jewish Cemetery in Berlin, Germany and advocating zero tolerance for criminals who violate cemeteries.
Items.AgendaNote: IMMEDIATE CONSIDERATION or Parks, Recreation, Cultural Affairs and Intergroup Relations
Items.MatterName: Cemeteries, Weissensee Jewish Cemetery, Denounce Desecretation

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing a fixed buffer zone around reproductive health care facilities.

State Legislation Resolution requesting the New York State Legislature to pass a bill, introduced by Committee on Rules, A.9041, "AN ACT to provide for the incorporation of the city of Staten Island and the incorporation of towns on the east end of Long Island into a new county to be known as Peconic."

Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A.2914, a bill that would strengthen the requirements for child abuse background checks of employees of agencies and other institutions having substantial contact with children, expand the types of agencies and other institutions required to make such background checks, and allow the State to share child abuse information with other states.
Items.MatterName: Child abuse background checks of employees

The President Pro Tem (Council Member Robles) put the question whether the Council would agree with and adopt such reports which were decided in the affirmative by the following vote:

The following files were removed from the General Order Calendar and voted separately:
 LU 504 & Res 1054, 
 LU 505 & Res 1055, 
 LU 506 & Res 1056.

 In the Introduction and Reading of Bills section:
 Res 1029 was Adopted.

Whereupon on motion of the Speaker (Council Member Vallone), the Clerk of the Council adjourned to meet again on Wednesday, November 10, 1999.

CARLOS CUEVAS, City Clerk
